FuncDef: The display access domain-interface command displays the interfaces to which a pre-authentication domain or authentication domain is bound.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a domain.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before you delete an authentication domain or pre-authentication domain, run the display access domain-interface command to view the interfaces to which the to-be-deleted domain is bound. Then, run the undo default-domain [ pre-authentication | authentication ] command to delete the domain from the sub-interfaces to which the domain is bound before deleting the domain in the system view.
Precautions
If the domain to be queried does not exist, the system prompts a message indicating that the current domain does not exist.
